Full Paragraph Text: The business environment was again marked by great uncertainty in 2014. Disruptive socio-economic and political change continued to affect growth in many parts of the world. In the emerging markets, economic volatility worsened as growth rates slowed and currencies weakened. In the developed markets, deflationary pressures and soft consumer demand resulted in a continued challenging trading environment. In the face of such uncertainty it was more important than ever to stay the course and remain loyal to our strategy, driving short-term performance while ensuring we made the right decisions to deliver our long-term goals. We took decisive steps to further our ambition to be the world’s recognised leading Nutrition, Health and Wellness company, trusted by all stakeholders, while again delivering financial results in 2014 that outperformed the market.

claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Company drives short-term performance to deliver long-term strategic goals amid market uncertainty.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly connects short-term performance in 2014 with long-term strategic goals through the phrase 'driving short-term performance while ensuring we made the right decisions to deliver our long-term goals.' This shows a clear causal relationship where short-term actions are deliberately designed to support long-term objectives.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Explicit references to 2014 results and 'short-term performance' and current decisions.; Long-Term: Explicit 'long-term goals' and ambition to be the recognised leading NHW company.

Full Paragraph Text: Through continuous innovation and renovation of our food and beverages portfolio we are able to offer people healthier and tastier choices at every stage of their life, at any time of the day. Science-based innovation enables us to enhance the quality of people’s diets, using our knowledge and our research and development capability to make a positive contribution to society. Wherever you are in the world, we have safe, nutritious products to help you care for yourself and your family. A few years ago, we expanded the boundaries of Nutrition, Health and Wellness with the creation of Nestlé Health Science, motivated by the opportunity to forge a major therapeutic role for nutrition in the management of health. In line with this broadened strategy, in 2014 the Board approved the sale of 48.5 million L’Oréal shares to L’Oréal for cancellation. Part of the proceeds were used for the acquisition of the 50% stake in our joint venture Galderma from L’Oréal, bringing our ownership of Galderma to 100%. Galderma formed the foundation of a new Nestlé subsidiary, Nestlé Skin Health. Its goal is to be recognised as the leading company in skin health, offering science-based solutions to protect, nourish and enhance skin, and where needed to treat, correct and restore damaged skin over the course of people’s lives. Nestlé Skin Health provides prescription drugs, self-medication, therapeutic skin care and aesthetic and corrective medicine, allowing us to compete in the growing and promising multi-billion global skincare market. Nestlé Skin Health was further strengthened by the acquisition of the full rights to commercialise several key aesthetic dermatology products in the United States and Canada.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: 2014 Board approval of L'Oréal share sale and Galderma acquisition - specific year mentioned; Long-Term: Continuous innovation, life-stage nutrition, and 'over the course of people's lives' skin health solutions
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] 2014 strategic acquisitions enabled long-term skin health capabilities across people's lifespans.
claude4: Rationale: The 2014 Board-approved transactions (L'Oréal share sale, Galderma acquisition) directly enabled Nestlé's long-term strategy to provide skin health solutions 'over the course of people's lives.' This represents a clear causal link from specific short-term corporate actions to long-term strategic capabilities.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: 2014 Board-approved sale and immediate acquisition/foundation actions occurred within a year.; Medium-Term: The broadened strategy begun 'a few years ago' indicates a multi-year strategic shift.; Long-Term: Aim to be recognised as the leading skin-health company and life-course framing imply decades.

gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties a multi-year strategic broadening to the 2014 sale, and the resulting subsidiary to a long-term leadership goal. Other mentions (e.g., market growth) lack explicit timeframes, so were excluded.

Full Paragraph Text: These developments ensure that, building on the strong foundations of our food and beverages business and guided increasingly by science, we can further expand our portfolio to provide promising platforms for future growth in line with our strategy of Nutrition, Health and Wellness. At the same time, we continue the drive to ensure our company is organised efficiently and effectively to deliver continuous profitable growth over the long term. With this objective in mind we made some key decisions, adapting our organisational structure to better prepare ourselves today to meet the challenges of tomorrow.

Full Paragraph Text: While our company continues to benefit from its decentralised structure, allowing key decisions to be made as close as possible to consumers, there is still an important opportunity to better leverage our scale. That is why in 2014 we set up Nestlé Business Excellence at Executive Board Level, combining GLOBE (Nestlé’s Global Business Excellence function) with Nestlé Business Services (our shared operation for transactional services around the world) and Nestlé Con tinuous Excellence (our continuous improvement and LEAN programme). Through a focus on three areas: Simplifying, Standardising and Sharing, Nestlé Business Excellence will allow us to decrease structural costs and operational expenses, freeing up resources to support growth. This will also allow our markets to keep a sharp focus on generating demand.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Setting up Nestlé Business Excellence in 2014 represents a specific organizational restructuring action; Long-Term: The company's ongoing decentralized structure and the strategic goal to 'leverage scale' represent sustained organizational approaches
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] 2014 organizational restructuring designed to enable sustained cost reduction and growth support.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph shows a clear causal link where a specific 2014 organizational change (Short-Term) is explicitly designed to achieve ongoing structural cost reduction and resource optimization (Long-Term). The restructuring combines existing functions to create lasting operational improvements.

4o: Rationale: The establishment of Nestlé Business Excellence in 2014 is a medium-term strategy designed to improve operations. This strategy is expected to yield short-term benefits by reducing costs and focusing on demand generation, demonstrating a clear cross-scale interaction from medium to short term.

gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: 'key decisions to be made as close as possible to consumers' refers to daily operational decisions. 'generating demand' implies immediate market activities like sales and marketing occurring daily/weekly.; Medium-Term: 'decrease structural costs and operational expenses' is a strategic financial goal realized and measured over several years. 'freeing up resources' is a consequence of cost reduction, enabling investments over a multi-year horizon.; Long-Term: 'decentralised structure' is an enduring organizational characteristic. 'set up Nestlé Business Excellence' (and its focus on 'continuous improvement') indicates a strategic program with multi-decade impact. 'support growth' is an overarching, continuous business objective spanning decades.

Separately, the company's existing Long-Term decentralized structure is identified as enabling Short-Term decision-making.

Full Paragraph Text: We have integrated the Maghreb, the Middle East, the North East Africa region, Turkey and Israel into Zone Europe to form Zone EMENA (Europe, Middle East and North Africa). This balances the different consumer dynamics and opportunities in each geography. Additionally it allows a sharper focus in Zone Asia, Oceania and Africa, a fast-growing part
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a completed organizational restructuring that integrates regions into Zone EMENA and mentions current benefits like balanced consumer dynamics and sharper focus. While it references 'fast-growing' regions, there are no explicit causal relationships between events at different temporal scales - no clear short-term actions leading to long-term outcomes or vice versa.

These are sustained strategic initiatives or outcomes intended to last for 1-5 years.; Long-Term: Refers to Zone Asia, Oceania and Africa being described as 'a fast-growing part,' which indicates a sustained multi-year to multi-decade trend of regional development and growth (>5 years).

This focus is directly influenced by the long-term characteristic of that region being 'fast-growing,' establishing a causal link where the long-term trend informs the medium-term strategy. No other explicit cross-scale links were identified, and no short-term elements met the explicit causality criteria.

Full Paragraph Text: The new Nestlé Business Excellence function is led by Chris Johnson, the former head of Zone Americas. Zone Americas is now led by Laurent Freixe, the former head of Zone Europe, and the new Zone EMENA by Luis Cantarell, who previously was in charge of Nestlé Nutrition and Nestlé Health Science. The new head of Nestlé Nutrition is Heiko Schipper, who was formerly responsible for our Global Infant Nutrition division. Nestlé Health Science is led by Greg Behar, who joined the company from Boehringer Ingelheim in July. The newly established Nestlé Skin Health is led by Humberto Antunes, former ly the Chief Executive Officer of our joint venture Galderma.

Full Paragraph Text: We further reinforced our business through continued active portfolio management, reviewing the performance of different products in different markets to assess strate gic fit, the extent to which they were accretive against our financial targets, and what investments were necessary to deliver growth. We made choices about where we wanted to invest, where we wanted to improve, and what we wanted to divest. Making such choices enables us to align our resourc es behind our best ideas, products and categories, to deliver sustained financial performance and help us on our journey to recognised Nutrition, Health and Wellness leadership over the short term and the long term.

Full Paragraph Text: We also announced new investments and research collaborations, which will enhance our ability to deliver sci ence-based solutions to improve the quality of people’s lives. A newly-announced research partnership with the EpiGen consortium will help us to better develop our understanding of the influence of nutrition and genetics at the beginning of life and continue to build our knowledge in this important area. The Nestlé Institute of Health Sciences began a collab oration on a groundbreaking project, which could one day lead to the development of made-to-measure vitamin com binations tailored to individual needs. Our company was founded almost 150 years ago on the product Henri Nestlé invented, farine lactée. It saved the life of a child. Today we continue to invest in science-based innovation to ensure we can answer current and future needs.

Full Paragraph Text: It is our fundamental belief that to be successful over time we need to create value for our shareholders while at the same time creating value for society. We call this Creating Shared Value. To prosper we have to take a long-term view, framed in a robust set of principles and values that are based on respect: respect for people, respect for the environment, and respect for the world we live in. What we do and the effects of what we do are highly visible. It is our responsibility to connect with different stakeholders, to show transparency and build trust. We have therefore again in 2014 reported on our social performance and our compliance in our Nestlé in society report, and our progress towards meeting the tough targets we set ourselves.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: 2014 reporting on social performance and compliance represents annual/yearly reporting activities; Long-Term: Taking a 'long-term view' and being 'successful over time' explicitly references extended timeframes beyond 5 years
claude4: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Long-term strategic principles drive annual reporting and compliance activities.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph establishes that taking a 'long-term view' with robust principles directly influences specific short-term actions like the 2014 reporting and target-setting. The long-term strategic framework provides the foundation for annual operational activities.
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph mentions a Long-Term view and a specific 2014 (Short-Term) report, but it does not explicitly state a causal link between them across scales. Targets lack timeframes, so they are unmappable.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 we held another successful Creating Shared Value forum, this time at the Nestlé Research Center in Lausanne, co-organised for the first time with a United Nations body, the UN Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD). The President of the Swiss Confederation used his address to the event to plead for water to become a self-standing goal of the future global development agenda. At the event we renewed our long-standing partnership with the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies. Since 2006 this collaboration has focused on the improvement of rural communities’ access to clean water and sanitation.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The 2014 forum event and renewal of partnership represent immediate actions within a single year; Long-Term: The collaboration 'Since 2006' represents an 8-year ongoing partnership spanning decades of work
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] 2014 forum renewal reinforces ongoing 8-year water access partnership
claude4: Rationale: The 2014 forum event directly caused the renewal of a long-term partnership. The short-term action of holding the forum and making the renewal announcement explicitly reinforced and continued the long-term collaborative relationship that began in 2006.

gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] A 2014 address sought to shape the future development agenda, and renewing a since-2006 partnership extended long-term water/sanitation efforts.

4o: Rationale: The 2014 forum is a short-term event that explicitly renewed a long-term partnership focused on water and sanitation. This renewal links the short-term event to the long-term goal of improving rural communities' access to clean water and sanitation.

Full Paragraph Text: Currently, at the United Nations there are intense discussions about the global development goals for the period after 2015. At the same time, governments and international organ isations are increasingly reliant on the expertise, experience and resources of the private sector to help address some of the world’s most pressing problems. This offers an opportunity for global companies such as Nestlé to make a valu able contribution, in partnership with governments and civil society. We are participating actively in the policy dialogue in areas which will deeply influence our future business, such as food security, nutrition and health, water, sustainability, and human rights.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Current UN discussions about post-2015 development goals and active participation in policy dialogue; Long-Term: Future business operations that will be deeply influenced by these policy areas over time
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Current UN policy discussions and company participation will shape future business operations.
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly states that current policy dialogue participation in areas like food security and sustainability 'will deeply influence our future business,' creating a clear causal link from present short-term activities to long-term business outcomes.
gpt5: Rationale: Only present-time actions (“currently” and ongoing participation) and vague future references are given. No explicit multi-year duration or clear cross-scale causal link is stated (e.g., “after 2015” lacks a defined timespan).
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses ongoing discussions and partnerships without specifying concrete events or actions with explicit timeframes that map to different temporal scales. Therefore, no cross-scale interactions are identified.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Activities described as 'currently' happening or 'are participating actively' refer to actions taking place in the present, typically within a year's timeframe.; Long-Term: References to 'global development goals for the period after 2015' (implying multi-decade goals like the SDGs) and 'areas which will deeply influence our future business' (pertaining to systemic global challenges like food security and human rights, with impacts spanning decades) clearly define timeframes extending beyond 5 years.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] The paragraph explicitly describes how current discussions and active participation influence long-term global development goals and future business directions.
gemini2.5: Rationale: Two temporal scales, Short-Term and Long-Term, were identified based on the provided definitions. The text contains two explicit causal links where present (Short-Term) actions directly contribute to or shape future long-term outcomes. No explicit Medium-Term interactions were identified within the paragraph.

Full Paragraph Text: Our success has always been based upon our determination to stay the course and look ahead, to understand the environment in which we operate, to organise ourselves to seize opportunities to deliver profitable growth, now and in the future. Although we are operating in a challenging and turbulent economic environment, we see these as fascinating times, full of opportunities. We continue to commit ourselves to ambitious financial targets. We aim to achieve organic growth of around 5% to 6%, improvements in margins and underlying earnings per share in constant currencies, as well as capital efficiency. There will be years when we exceed our ambition and years where we come close, but this is the line we want to walk over time.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Current operations in challenging economic environment, annual financial targets, and year-to-year performance variations; Long-Term: Long-term strategic positioning ('look ahead', 'now and in the future', 'over time')
claude4: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Strategic long-term vision drives current financial targets and annual performance commitments.
claude4: Rationale: The text shows how long-term strategic thinking ('look ahead', 'now and in the future', 'over time') explicitly drives short-term financial commitments and annual targets. The company's forward-looking approach directly influences their current ambitious financial goals and year-to-year performance expectations.
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph mentions year-to-year outcomes and a path 'over time' but provides no explicit durations for targets and no clear causal link between different temporal scales.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The aim to achieve organic growth of around 5% to 6% and improvements in margins and earnings per share suggests a focus on annual financial performance.; Long-Term: The phrase 'this is the line we want to walk over time' implies a sustained strategy over decades.
4o: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Short-term financial targets are part of a sustained strategy over time.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph outlines short-term financial goals that are part of a broader long-term strategy. The explicit mention of 'over time' indicates a long-term perspective, linking short-term actions to long-term objectives.
gemini2.5: Links: Long-Term -> Short-Term | Medium-Term -> Short-Term | Short-Term -> Long-Term | Medium-Term -> Long-Term
gemini2.5: Final Link: Long-Term -> Short-Term, Medium-Term -> Short-Term, Short-Term -> Long-Term, Medium-Term -> Long-Term
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: 'now' refers to immediate actions, 'operating in a challenging and turbulent economic environment' indicates current conditions, and 'years when we exceed our ambition and years where we come close' describes annual performance variability.; Medium-Term: 'aim to achieve organic growth of around 5% to 6%' and 'improvements in margins' represent specific financial targets typically pursued over a period of 1 to 5 years.; Long-Term: 'Our success has always been based upon' signifies an enduring foundation, 'stay the course and look ahead' implies a long-term vision, and 'this is the line we want to walk over time' describes an overarching strategic trajectory.

It outlines medium-term financial targets ('aim to achieve organic growth of 5-6%') which guide short-term annual performance ('years when we exceed/come close'). These various scales interact as the long-term strategy provides the context for immediate growth, medium-term goals define short-term ambitions, and the aggregation of short-term results ultimately shapes the long-term path.

Full Paragraph Text: We would like to thank our 339000 employees, whose com mitment to Nestlé, hard work and disciplined alignment behind our strategy ensured that we achieved our common goals. Their talent, their creativity, their discipline and entrepreneurship are key to delivering our results. We would also like to thank you, our shareholders, for your investment and your confidence, which have enabled us to deliver good returns for investors over the long term.

Full Paragraph Text: For almost 150 years we have enhanced people’s lives by offer ing tastier and healthier food and beverages choices at all stages of life and at any time of day, helping them care for themselves and their families. We have built our success by anticipating the future and continuously adapting ourselves to seize the opportunities it presents.

The text explicitly states they 'built our success' over 150 years 'by anticipating the future and continuously adapting,' showing how long-term achievement enables ongoing short-term strategic responses.

The causal link is that the anticipated future (Long-Term) provides the context for and leads to the Short-Term actions of seizing opportunities.

Full Paragraph Text: The Nestlé Strategic Roadmap (facing page) is our compass, driving internal alignment behind our goals. The roadmap shows the strengths we leverage to drive performance and deliver com petitive advantage. Our strong culture, values and principles, all based on respect, unite us worldwide.

Full Paragraph Text: Our ambition is not just to be the leader but the industry refer ence for Nutrition, Health and Wellness. In recent years we have built on the strong foundations of our unrivalled food and bev erage portfolio, exploring the benefits of nutrition’s therapeutic role with Nestlé Health Science. In 2014 we again expanded the boundaries of Nutrition, Health and Wellness with the creation of Nestlé Skin Health, offering scientifically-proven products and solutions for people’s skin health needs throughout their lives.

Full Paragraph Text: Start Healthy Stay Healthy is our interactive, science-based education programme designed to help parents and care givers provide nutritionally and developmentally adequate nutrition in the crucial first 1000 days of life. We support and promote breastfeeding as the best start a baby can have in life. Our educational programmes are targeted at people who are most involved in implementing good practices during this important early period in a child’s development. We help to guide parents and caregivers to raise healthier children and help healthcare professionals have a greater impact on the nutritional aspects of care of future generations.

Full Paragraph Text: We continue to reinforce our leadership in the area of chil dren’s nutrition. By the end of 2014 98% of all our products for children met the Nestlé Nutritional Foundation criteria for children. These criteria are based on nutrition science and public health dietary recommendations from bodies such as the World Health Organization and the Institute of Medicine. Our products are evaluated against these criteria using the Nestlé Nutritional Profiling System which determines their nutritional value and whether they achieve Nestlé Nutritional Foundation status.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a completed achievement by end of 2014 (98% compliance) and explains the evaluation system, but contains no explicit causal relationships between different temporal scales. The text focuses on describing current status and methodology rather than cross-temporal influences.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a past achievement (by the end of 2014) without indicating any explicit cross-scale temporal interactions. No causal links between different temporal scales are present.

gemini2.5: Final Link: Long-Term -> Medium-Term, Medium-Term -> Short-Term, Long-Term -> Short-Term

'Nutrition science and public health dietary recommendations' represent foundational, evolving knowledge bases over decades.

It also shows how these long-term criteria shape the medium-term profiling system, which in turn determines the short-term product status. Full Paragraph Text: We are carrying out large-scale studies together with lead ing scientists of children’s diet and lifestyles, based on the success of the Nestlé Feeding Infants and Toddlers Study. In addition to dietary intakes and behaviours, our research explores family dynamics around diets and key lifestyle patterns of children while documenting their height and weight. We use this data to support our product reformulation, consumer communication and educational programmes, and we share the results with the wider scientific community, non-governmental organisations and others.

Full Paragraph Text: We ensure global compliance with responsible advertising and marketing standards for children, abiding by external pledges such as the EU Pledge. At the end of 2014, the Ex ecutive Board approved an updated and strengthened Nestlé Marketing Communication to Children Policy, which will come into effect in December 2015. To ensure consistent and effective implementation, detailed internal guidelines have been developed and external stakeholders are encouraged to provide feedback via our Tell us reporting mechanism. We have phased out our marketing communication in schools and reinforced our health and wellness education activities, particularly those that positively impact children’s development and support governments’ goals to increase physical activity.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Policy approval at end of 2014 and implementation in December 2015 represent events within a 1-year timeframe; Medium-Term: Phasing out marketing in schools and reinforcing education activities represent multi-year strategic transitions

Full Paragraph Text: By the end of 2014 the Nestlé Healthy Kids programme was in 73 countries, supporting initiatives which demonstrate how appropriate nutrition and exercise can improve the health of children and their communities. In addition, our own studies in four countries have shown that two thirds of children are insufficiently hydrated when they arrive at school. In 2014 we provided tools and information that schools, parents and caregivers need to ensure children learn about the benefits of healthy hydration.

While the programme aims to improve children's health, there is no explicit causal connection described between different temporal scales - no indication of how short-term actions lead to medium or long-term outcomes, or vice versa.

Learning is a sustained effort that extends beyond one year but typically shows significant progress or completion within 1 to 5 years.; Long-Term: The 'benefits of healthy hydration' are positive impacts on health that accrue over decades or a lifetime, aligning with the '>5 years / decades' definition.

Full Paragraph Text: United for Healthier Kids is a platform, created by Nestlé in 2014, where society can engage and collaborate to find ways to improve the health and wellness of children, from conception to the age of 12 years. In Mexico, a TV series was launched which supports and encourages five families looking to change their eating and lifestyle habits over six months. The platform has also been launched in the Philippines.

Full Paragraph Text: Through innovation and renovation we continue to make our products tastier and healthier. In line with the recommendations from public health authorities, we are reducing the amount of salt, sugar and saturated fats in our products as part of our contribution towards the fight against non-communicable diseases in society. Our reduction targets are in cluded in our public nutrition commitments (detailed in the Nestlé in society report) so our progress can be measured. We are also ensuring that whole grains are the primary ingredient in our breakfast cereals for children and teenagers.

Full Paragraph Text: We want to help people who buy our products to make informed decisions by giving them better nutritional information on our product labels. Full Paragraph Text: In parts of the world where people find it difficult to get essential vitamins and minerals in their daily diets, we fortify foods to help them and their families stay healthy. Full Paragraph Text: In 2014, we transformed a dairy factory in Mexico into the company’s first ‘zero water’ manufacturing site in the world. Cow’s milk is 88% water, so by extracting some of it to use in the factory’s systems, we are saving enough water to meet the average daily consumption of 6400 people in the surrounding area.

Full Paragraph Text: The new technology used at the factory in Jalisco, Mexico, heats milk at low pressure to remove some of the water. The resulting steam is then condensed and treated and used to clean machines. It is then recycled and used again. The process reduces by 15% the total amount of water used by Nestlé Mexico. Work is now underway to deploy similar tech nology in five other manufacturing sites in water stressed are as around the world. It is just one of a number of water-saving initiatives we have introduced in recent years, allowing us to reduce total water withdrawal in absolute terms by almost one third in the last decade.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Current deployment to five other manufacturing sites and recent years of water-saving initiatives; Long-Term: Almost one third reduction in total water withdrawal over the last decade

Full Paragraph Text: The successful roll-out of Maggi Oats Noodles demonstrated that healthy eating can be both enjoyable and tasty. Strong sales of the new product show that it is also good business. Maggi Oats Noodles meet Nestlé Nutritional Foundation criteria, which are based on public health recommendations. The consumer communication reinforces the importance for families to start the day with a well-balanced breakfast, including fruits and milk. In 2014, we continued to renovate Maggi products all around the world, reducing salt and fat and improving their nutritional benefits.

While it mentions 2014 renovations and ongoing sales, these are presented as separate facts rather than causally linked processes across different timeframes.

gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly says the criteria are based on public health recommendations and that the product meets those criteria, tying long-term guidance to short-term product actions. No explicit medium-term timeline is stated.

gemini2.5: Final Link: Long-Term -> Medium-Term, Short-Term -> Medium-Term, Medium-Term -> Long-Term

Simultaneously, specific Short-Term product renovations directly contribute to achieving these Medium-Term nutritional standards, and ongoing Medium-Term consumer communications reinforce the broader Long-Term public health goals mentioned.

Full Paragraph Text: The Maggi company began selling powdered soups in Switzerland in 1885. Julius Maggi had pioneered the production of pea and bean soups at the request of the Swiss Public Welfare Society to address the dietary deficiency of the work ing population. The advent of factory work for women meant less time to prepare food, and the soups were a convenient and nourishing alternative.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The company began selling powdered soups in 1885 and the immediate convenience need for working women with less time to prepare food; Long-Term: The advent of factory work for women represents a broader societal transformation spanning decades of industrialization
claude4: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Industrialization's impact on women's work patterns drove immediate market demand for convenient food solutions.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph shows how the long-term societal shift of women entering factory work created the immediate business opportunity that Maggi capitalized on in 1885. The causal link is explicit: factory work meant less cooking time, creating demand for convenient soups.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: Societal conditions like widespread dietary deficiency and industrial work shifts persist over years/decades.; Short-Term: Discrete actions such as a specific organizational request occur within a year.
gpt5: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Ongoing dietary deficiency prompted a one-off request by the Swiss Public Welfare Society.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties a persistent societal deficiency to a discrete organizational request. Other elements (e.g., factory work’s advent, 1885 sales) lack explicit cross-scale causal phrasing.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes historical events without explicit temporal cross-scale interactions. The focus is on the introduction of a product in 1885, which does not map to the defined temporal scales or show causal links across different scales.
gemini2.5: Links: Long-Term -> Medium-Term | Medium-Term -> Short-Term | Long-Term -> Short-Term | Short-Term -> Long-Term
gemini2.5: Final Link: Long-Term -> Medium-Term, Medium-Term -> Short-Term, Long-Term -> Short-Term, Short-Term -> Long-Term

The ongoing role of 'the soups were a convenient and nourishing alternative' also describes a sustained, long-term impact.; Medium-Term: 'Pioneered the production' implies a development and setup project that typically spans more than a year but less than five, fitting the Medium-Term scale.; Short-Term: 'Began selling powdered soups in Switzerland in 1885' represents a specific product launch or initial market entry event occurring within a single year, classifying it as Short-Term.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Long-Term, Medium-Term, Short-Term] Long-term societal issues and trends spurred medium-term product development, which led to short-term market entry, with both long-term societal changes driving and being addressed by the short-term product introduction.

This project then led to the short-term launch of the product. The launch, in turn, established the product's long-term utility in addressing those ongoing societal needs. All three distinct temporal scales are explicitly involved in these causal interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: Parents want their children to make the most of their potential. Nestlé Milo, which is mainly consumed by children aged 7–12, can help to provide the nourishing energy they need to succeed. Activ-Go plays a role in energy release, muscle function, bone maintenance and red blood cell formation, all essential for physical activity.

All statements are general descriptions of nutritional functions without temporal framing or cross-scale interactions.

No Medium-Term interactions were identified, as all durations fell clearly into either daily needs or life-long goals.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Milo celebrated its 80th birthday in 2014. It was created by Nestlé engineer Thomas Mayne to help children who had poor diets get sufficient nutrition. He created Nestlé Milo from malt, milk and cocoa to give children the nutritious energy they need to get the best out of their day. It was launched at the Sydney Easter Show in 1934.

Full Paragraph Text: The Group’s trading operating profit was CHF 14.0 billion, representing a margin of 15.3%, up 10 basis points, and up 30 basis points in constant currencies. The cost of goods sold fell by 30 basis points as a percentage of sales, driven by product mix and pricing actions and savings created by Nestlé Continuous Excellence which more than offset increases in raw material costs. Distribution costs were up by 10 basis points. Total marketing and administration expenses rose by 10 basis points as we increased consumer facing marketing support for our brands.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 we delivered strong results in a soft trading environment, building on the good growth of past years. They demonstrate the intrinsic strengths of Nestlé: the commit ment of our people, our global footprint, the strength of our portfolio and the quality of our innovation. While delivering in the short term, we remain focused on our business long term, strengthening the foundations of future growth.

Full Paragraph Text: Our performance in North America was affected by the frozen category. Projects are underway to reposition Lean Cuisine, Hot Pockets and Stouffers. They address all elements of the marketing mix, reflecting trends such as organic and ethnic, enhancing the brands’ relevance to consumers. We are taking the same approach in frozen pizza where our California Pizza Kitchen did well. In ice cream the super premium segment performed well with Gelato, and snacks returned to growth, although the premium segment was subdued. In confectionery the successful roll-out of Butterfinger Peanut Butter Cups continued. Innovations like Natural Bliss and seasonal renovations of flavours helped Coffee-mate de liver good growth. Innovation also ensured the petcare busi ness in North America continued to grow with Dog Chow, Pro Plan and Tidy Cats Lightweight cat litter as highlights. The launch of Beyond natural pet food gained momentum.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes various business activities and performance outcomes but lacks explicit temporal framing or causal connections between different time scales. While terms like 'continued' and 'ongoing' suggest duration, there are no clear statements linking short-term actions to long-term outcomes or vice versa.

Full Paragraph Text: Latin America delivered good organic growth despite a worsening of the macroeconomic situation towards the end of the year. Although consumer sentiment varied across the region, most markets did well. All Brazil’s categories grew, with Ninho in growing-up milks, KitKat in confectionery, Nesfit in biscuits and Nescau in cocoa and malt beverages making strong contributions. In Mexico the changes in fiscal legislation, pricing and subdued consumer demand affect ed the market. Nescafé Dolce Gusto delivered double-digit growth across the region, while Dog Chow and Pro Plan drove sales in the petcare business.

claude4: Summary: [Medium-Term, Short-Term] Fiscal legislation changes affected immediate market conditions and consumer demand.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph shows how medium-term fiscal legislation changes in Mexico causally influenced short-term market conditions and consumer demand. The worsening macroeconomic situation and brand performance represent short-term effects, while legislative changes represent structural medium-term shifts.

Full Paragraph Text: The slower growth in the Zone was due to our largest market China and to Oceania. In China we needed to adapt our portfolio to reconnect with the fast-changing expectations of the Chinese consumer. Therefore, in addition to correcting trade stocks throughout the year, we focused on innovation, on reformulation and on re-launches, particularly in coffee, ready-to-drink and confectionery. We continued to see good performances in ambient culinary, ice cream and ready-to drink coffee. In Oceania we are focused on developing new trade channels.

Full Paragraph Text: However, Unilever’s business model and strategy proved robust, delivering a competitive performance with underlying sales growth ahead of the market and solid margin expansion. The Boards remain convinced that a clear, purpose-driven business model is the best way for Unilever to continue generating sustainable, long-term returns for all stakeholders, including our shareholders, as proved by a year of strong, dependable cash flow and steadily increasing dividends. The full year dividend paid in 2014 rose to €1.12, a 7% increase on 2013.

Full Paragraph Text: In China we undertook large capital expenditure, building a new dry savoury plant and a new washing powder factory. In Indonesia, large-scale capital investment was made in Siliwangi, creating a plant for Cikarang Foods, adding significant capacity to dry and wet savoury production. In the Philippines a new dry savoury factory was built. Detergent and ice cream factories were built in Africa.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes completed capital investments and factory construction across multiple countries, but provides no temporal information about when these occurred, their duration, or any causal relationships between events at different time scales. All activities are presented as past accomplishments without explicit timeframes or cross-scale interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: Operating in an environment of almost unprecedented volatility and complexity will remain a big challenge for everyone. Few people predicted that in 2014 we would see such a sharp slowdown in some of the major world economies or the escalation of geopolitical conflicts or the outbreak of pandemics like Ebola and oil prices ending the year at less than US $50 a barrel. We must be prepared for a similarly unpredictable year in 2015.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph discusses various events from 2014 and preparation for 2015, but these are all short-term occurrences within a 1-2 year timeframe. While it mentions 'unprecedented volatility' as an ongoing challenge, there are no explicit causal relationships described between different temporal scales - only observations about unpredictable events within the same short-term period.
gpt5: Rationale: All referenced events and preparation are tied to specific years (2014–2015), i.e., Short-Term. No explicit multi-year or decades-long processes, and no stated cross-scale causal links.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses events from 2014 and anticipates unpredictability in 2015, both of which fall under the Short-Term scale. There are no explicit cross-scale interactions mentioned.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph identifies a Long-Term state ('operating in an environment of almost unprecedented volatility and complexity will remain a big challenge') and provides Short-Term examples (2014 events) that illustrate this state. It also mentions a Short-Term action (preparation for 2015) in response to the observed Short-Term events of 2014. However, there are no explicit causal links stated between events or states of different temporal scales in the text.

Full Paragraph Text: The key is to have a model that responds to people’s needs and concerns, and an organisation that is both resilient and agile in the face of growing economic and geopolitical uncertainty. We achieved that again in 2014 and I want to thank – and recognise – the supreme efforts of our 172,000 colleagues and the many more partners around the world.
claude4: Rationale: While the paragraph mentions 2014 achievements and references 'growing economic and geopolitical uncertainty,' it does not establish explicit causal relationships between different temporal scales. The text describes organizational qualities and acknowledges past performance without connecting short-term actions to long-term processes or vice versa.
gpt5: Rationale: Only a single-year achievement in 2014 is explicit (Short-Term). “Growing uncertainty” has no explicit duration, and no explicit causal link across different time scales is stated.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph lacks explicit temporal cross-scale interactions. It mentions achievements in 2014, but does not link this to any longer-term or shorter-term processes or outcomes.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: Refers to the enduring 'model' and 'organisation' characteristics (resilient, agile) which are strategic, fundamental, and deal with 'growing economic and geopolitical uncertainty', implying a duration beyond 5 years.; Short-Term: Refers to the specific 'achievement... in 2014', which is an outcome tied to a single year.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] The long-term strategic model and organizational resilience enabled the specific short-term achievement in 2014.

The phrase 'The key is to have... We achieved that' directly implies a causal relationship. Only two scales are identified as Medium-Term interactions are not mentioned.

Full Paragraph Text: We expect the economic pressures to continue. Consumer demand in emerging markets is likely to remain subdued for some time to come. There is still little sign of a recovery in Europe and, while conditions in North America have improved, any increase in consumer demand is likely to be slow and shoppers will remain focused on value.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Current economic pressures and improved conditions in North America represent immediate market conditions; Long-Term: Subdued consumer demand 'for some time to come' and slow recovery expectations indicate extended multi-year processes
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Current economic pressures drive expectations of prolonged market weakness and slow recovery.

The causal link is explicit through phrases like 'expect to continue' and 'likely to remain subdued for some time to come.'
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit durations map cleanly to Short-/Medium-/Long-Term, and no clear cross-scale causal links are stated. Phrases like “some time to come” and “likely to be slow” are vague, not scale-specific.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses ongoing economic pressures and consumer demand trends without specifying timeframes that map to distinct temporal scales. No explicit cross-scale causal links are present.

Subsequent sentences detail specific trends like subdued consumer demand and slow recovery in various regions, which are classified as Medium-Term given their typical duration of 1-5 years. These Medium-Term observations are presented as the underlying reasons and evidence for the initial Long-Term expectation, establishing an explicit causal link from Medium-Term trends to Long-Term outcomes.

Full Paragraph Text: We are also prepared for managing any continuing volatility on the world’s currency markets and for what could be fluctuations in commodity costs as a result of the reduction in oil prices. Full Paragraph Text: Despite these pressures, we are confident that with the many positive changes we have already made to Unilever we are well placed to continue delivering our objectives of volume growth ahead of our markets, steady and sustainable improvements in core operating margin, and strong cash flow.

The 'changes already made' and future objectives are mentioned without specific durations or cross-scale interactions.

The term 'sustainable' indicates an enduring trend over more than 5 years, thus categorized as Long-Term. This forms a clear causal link from Medium-Term strategic actions to Long-Term outcomes.

Full Paragraph Text: Even though we have made significant strides over recent years in improving our organisational agility and our ability to respond quickly to events, there is still room for improvement. I would like to have seen us react a little quicker, for example, to the slowdown in a number of markets, particularly China, where frankly we were caught off-guard by the speed and scale of weakening consumer demand. In terms of our categories, all of them contributed – albeit in different ways – to the overall performance of the Group and I have confidence in the strength and long-term growth potential of our portfolio.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Recent years of organizational improvements, quick reactions to market events, and immediate response to China market slowdown; Long-Term: Long-term growth potential of the portfolio mentioned explicitly
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Current portfolio performance builds confidence in long-term growth potential despite recent market challenges.
claude4: Rationale: The text shows how short-term organizational improvements and current category performance contribute to confidence in long-term growth potential. The link is explicit through the phrase connecting current performance to 'long-term growth potential of our portfolio.'
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: “Over recent years” indicates multi-year efforts to improve organisational agility.; Short-Term: “Ability to respond quickly to events” and reacting to market slowdowns are near-term responses.
gpt5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Short-Term] Multi-year agility improvements enhanced rapid event response.
gpt5: Rationale: The text ties multi-year agility improvements to quicker event response, an explicit cross-scale causality. The long-term portfolio confidence lacks an explicit causal link to short-term events, so it’s excluded.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses short-term reactions to market slowdowns and links them to the long-term growth potential of the portfolio. The short-term agility in responding to market changes is crucial for sustaining long-term growth, establishing a clear cross-scale interaction.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Refers to immediate market events and reactions like 'react a little quicker' and 'slowdown in markets', which typically occur within days to a year.; Medium-Term: Pertains to strategic organizational development over 'recent years' in 'improving organisational agility and ability to respond quickly', implying a duration greater than 1 year and up to 5 years.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term] The medium-term state of organizational agility influenced the short-term response to market events.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The text describes an ongoing Medium-Term process of improving organisational agility and response capability, which is explicitly noted as having 'still room for improvement'. This imperfect state of the Medium-Term capability directly influenced the company's failure to 'react a little quicker' to a specific Short-Term market slowdown. This establishes a clear cross-scale causal link from the Medium-Term state to a Short-Term outcome. The mention of 'long-term growth potential' does not form an explicit causal link with other scales in the paragraph.

Full Paragraph Text: We took steps last year to sharpen the portfolio even further with a number of strategic acquisitions and disposal of non-core brands, although there is always scope to do more and I would like to see the level of activity accelerate in the year ahead. It is also clear that we still need to do more to get our Foods category growing again, although we are winning market share.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Steps taken 'last year' and desired acceleration 'in the year ahead' represent actions within a 1-year timeframe; Medium-Term: Strategic acquisitions and disposals for portfolio sharpening represent multi-year strategic transitions that reshape the business structure

The Foods category growth challenge appears to be ongoing but lacks clear temporal causality between different scales.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses past and future actions but lacks explicit cross-scale causal links. The actions mentioned are within the Short-Term scale, with no clear Medium-Term or Long-Term interactions described.

gemini2.5: Rationale: The text identifies an explicit causal link: the 'need to do more' (a Short-Term directive for immediate action) is presented as the means 'to get our Foods category growing again.' Achieving sustained growth for an entire category typically spans multiple years, thus fitting the Medium-Term scale. Other temporal mentions, like 'took steps last year' and 'accelerate in the year ahead,' are confined to the Short-Term scale without explicit cross-scale interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: This is a tough business to be in – with much of our portfolio in flat or even declining developed markets – but we have to do more to leverage the strength of our wonderful Foods brands and bring back the growth momentum. By contrast, while our Home Care and Refreshment categories delivered good or solid growth, we need to increase the levels of cash and profitability if we are to invest in the many growth opportunities. These will all be priorities in 2015.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Priorities and actions planned for 2015 (within 1 year); Long-Term: Bringing back growth momentum and leveraging brand strength (ongoing strategic processes extending beyond immediate term)
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] 2015 priorities drive long-term growth momentum recovery
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph establishes a clear causal link where specific 2015 priorities and actions are designed to achieve longer-term strategic goals of growth momentum recovery and brand leverage. The short-term planning explicitly serves the long-term strategic objectives.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses short-term priorities for 2015 but does not explicitly link these to any medium-term or long-term strategies or outcomes. No cross-scale interactions are present.

This forms a direct causal link from a Long-Term market state to Short-Term strategic actions. No Medium-Term scales or other cross-scale links were explicitly identified, as all immediate actions mentioned were tied to the 2015 timeframe.

Full Paragraph Text: There is no doubt that over the long term our investors have benefited from their continued belief in Unilever, with total shareholder return increasing by a further 18% in 2014. Our employees remain a key priority of course and, despite the constrained economic environment, we did not compromise on our investments in training, personal development, safety and other employee support programmes. It was heartening to see employee engagement scores remain at historically high levels in our annual Global People Survey (GPS), with improvements across all five metrics.
claude4: Rationale: While the paragraph mentions 'long term' investor benefits and specific 2014 results, these represent parallel outcomes rather than explicit causal relationships between different temporal scales. The text describes concurrent achievements across timeframes without establishing that one temporal scale causally influences another.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses long-term benefits to investors and short-term employee engagement improvements, but lacks explicit cross-scale causal links between these events.
gemini2.5: Links: Long-Term -> Short-Term | Short-Term -> Long-Term | Long-Term -> Short-Term
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Refers to events within a year, such as '2014' results, 'annual Global People Survey' findings, and current 'investments' not being compromised.; Long-Term: Explicitly stated as 'over the long term' for investor benefits and implied by 'historically high levels' for employee engagement, indicating trends over decades.

Long-Term investor belief is shown to manifest in Short-Term gains, while Short-Term investment decisions contribute to sustained Long-Term employee engagement. Furthermore, Long-Term engagement levels are measured via Short-Term annual surveys. Only Short-Term and Long-Term scales were clearly discernible and sufficient for explaining the explicit temporal links.

Full Paragraph Text: It is also clear that the demand to join Unilever has never been greater. We received over 2 million applications or expressions of interest in 2014 and for the second year running Unilever was ranked the third most in-demand employer among jobseekers on LinkedIn, behind only Apple and Google, as more and more young people want to work for purpose-driven organisations.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes employer demand metrics from 2014 and a two-year ranking trend, but presents these as parallel observations rather than establishing explicit causal relationships between different temporal scales. The rising interest from young people in purpose-driven organizations is mentioned as context but not causally linked across timeframes.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Two explicit cross-scale interactions are identified where long-term trends influence short-term outcomes related to Unilever's employer demand.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links the sustained 'demand to join Unilever has never been greater' (Long-Term) to '2 million applications... in 2014' (Short-Term). Additionally, the ongoing trend that 'more and more young people want to work for purpose-driven organisations' (Long-Term) is given as the reason for Unilever being 'ranked the third most in-demand employer' (Short-Term). Both interactions illustrate how long-term patterns manifest in or explain specific short-term events.

Full Paragraph Text: We also made progress in our commitment to serve a wider group of stakeholders through the USLP and our Vision of growing the business while reducing our environmental footprint and increasing our positive social impact, not only in that part of the business under our direct control but throughout the whole value chain. This manifests itself in many different ways – everything from playing our part in putting an end to deforestation to ensuring we embrace and advance human rights principles throughout the length of our supply chain. You can see a number of examples set out in other parts of this report.

While these activities likely unfold across multiple timeframes, no specific durations or cross-scale causal relationships are stated in the text.
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph states broad commitments (e.g., end deforestation, advance human rights) without explicit timeframes or causal links across different temporal scales.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses broad commitments and goals without specifying concrete events or actions with explicit timeframes. No cross-scale causal links are identifiable.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] The outcomes of long-term strategies and commitments are explicitly documented as 'progress' and 'examples' in a short-term report.

This establishes a clear causal link where the effects of Long-Term efforts are reported within a Short-Term timeframe, fulfilling the cross-scale interaction criteria.

Full Paragraph Text: It was pleasing to see our efforts recognised once again in 2014, including regaining sector leadership in the prestigious Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI) and being ranked – for the fourth year running – as the Number One Company in the Globescan/SustainAbility index of leading sustainability experts around the world.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes recognition events and rankings that occurred in 2014 and mentions a four-year pattern, but these are all retrospective acknowledgments of past performance rather than causal relationships between different temporal scales. No explicit causal influence between short-term actions and long-term outcomes is described.
gpt5: Rationale: The text mentions 2014 recognition (Short-Term) and a four-year streak (Medium-Term) but does not state an explicit causal link between them.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes achievements in 2014 and rankings over four years, but lacks explicit cross-scale causal links between different temporal scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: Refers to the sustained 'efforts' and the continuous 'performance for the fourth year running' which spans multiple years (>1 up to 5 years).; Short-Term: Refers to the specific 'recognition' and 'ranking' events occurring within the single year 2014.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Short-Term] Sustained multi-year efforts and performance led to specific annual recognition and rankings in 2014.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links multi-year 'efforts' and 'sustained performance' (Medium-Term) to the 'recognition' and 'ranking' events of 2014 (Short-Term). Specifically, 'our efforts recognised' shows the former causing the latter. Additionally, the phrase 'for the fourth year running' highlights that the annual ranking is a direct result of a multi-year performance trend. No other scale interactions are present.

Full Paragraph Text: A fundamental requirement at Unilever is to understand our consumers. We use focus groups and quantitative studies and spend time with consumers in stores and in their homes to find out what is important to them – as citizens as well as consumers – so we can create products they need and want. Unilever carelines are also a rich source of information. Digital communications and social media mean we can engage with large numbers of people consistently over long periods of time so we can immerse ourselves in their day-to-day lives. We can use online search data to identify and anticipate future consumer trends and gain a competitive edge.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Day-to-day consumer lives and immediate engagement activities; Long-Term: Consistent engagement over long periods of time and anticipating future consumer trends
claude4: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Long-term consumer engagement enables understanding of daily consumer behaviors.
claude4: Rationale: The text shows how Unilever's long-term consistent engagement strategy through digital communications enables them to understand short-term day-to-day consumer behaviors. This creates a clear causal link from long-term strategic approach to short-term insights.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: “engage… consistently over long periods of time” via digital/social channels; Short-Term: “immerse ourselves in their day-to-day lives” indicates daily, short-horizon insight
gpt5: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Ongoing digital engagement over long periods enables immersion in consumers’ day-to-day lives.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links sustained, long-period engagement to accessing daily consumer contexts. Other items (e.g., future trends, competitive edge) lack explicit durations, so no additional cross-scale links are included.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Focus groups and quantitative studies provide immediate consumer insights.; Long-Term: Digital communications and social media engagement occur over long periods.
4o: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Short-term consumer insights from studies inform long-term engagement strategies via digital platforms.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes short-term activities like focus groups that provide immediate insights. These insights are used to inform long-term strategies involving digital engagement. The explicit link is the use of short-term data to guide long-term consumer interaction strategies.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Refers to 'day-to-day lives' (explicitly 'day-to-day') and 'online search data' which reflects immediate or very recent activities.; Medium-Term: Refers to 'future consumer trends' which implies developments over a >1 up to 5-year horizon, beyond immediate but not necessarily decades.; Long-Term: Refers to 'long periods of time' which is explicitly stated in the text.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term, Long-Term] Unilever engages consumers over long periods to understand day-to-day lives and uses short-term search data to anticipate medium-term future trends.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links the strategic choice to engage 'over long periods of time' (Long-Term) with understanding 'day-to-day lives' (Short-Term). Additionally, the use of immediate 'online search data' (Short-Term) is directly tied to anticipating 'future consumer trends' (Medium-Term, interpreted as a 1-5 year horizon). These connections demonstrate explicit cross-scale interactions using three distinct temporal scales.

Full Paragraph Text: R&D is an engine of sustainable growth; Unilever spends around €1 billion on R&D annually. Our 6,000 R&D professionals are responsible for building brands through benefit-led innovation, which is unlocked through science and technology. This includes looking at long-term emerging science and transforming science into technologies which are used to design branded products.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Annual R&D spending of €1 billion represents a yearly operational commitment; Long-Term: Long-term emerging science explicitly mentioned as a focus area spanning decades
claude4: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Long-term emerging science drives current product innovation and annual R&D investments.
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly states that long-term emerging science is transformed into technologies for designing branded products, creating a clear causal link from long-term research to short-term product development activities. The annual €1 billion spending represents the operational manifestation of this long-term scientific foundation.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Technologies are 'used to design branded products'—immediate application within operational/product cycles.; Long-Term: Explicit phrase 'long-term emerging science'.
gpt5: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Long-term emerging science is transformed into technologies applied to current product design.
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links long-term emerging science to technologies used in product design, indicating a long-to-short-term pipeline. Annual R&D spend is noted but not explicitly tied causally to the long-term work.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Annual R&D spending of €1 billion is a short-term action.; Long-Term: Focus on long-term emerging science indicates a long-term process.
4o: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Annual R&D spending supports the development of long-term emerging science and technology.
4o: Rationale: N/A
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The phrase 'annually' for R&D spending clearly indicates a cycle within 1 year.; Medium-Term: The act of 'designing branded products' typically involves development cycles lasting more than 1 year but generally less than 5 years.; Long-Term: 'Sustainable growth' implies a multi-decade horizon, and 'long-term emerging science' explicitly states the duration.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term, Long-Term] Annual R&D investment drives long-term sustainable growth, while insights from long-term emerging science are applied to design new branded products over the medium-term.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The text explicitly connects annual R&D spending (Short-Term) to achieving sustainable growth (Long-Term). Furthermore, the long-term exploration of emerging science (Long-Term) is described as a precursor to designing branded products (Medium-Term), demonstrating a clear progression across these scales. All identified scales are distinct and essential for capturing these explicit interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: To meet our Vision we know we must work in partnership with others, such as suppliers, agencies, universities, governments and NGOs.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a general strategic approach to partnerships but contains no temporal elements or timeframes. While 'Vision' implies a future goal, there are no explicit causal relationships between different temporal scales - only a statement about the necessity of working with partners to achieve an unspecified vision.
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit timeframes or durations are stated, and no causal links across different temporal scales are described; thus no cross-scale interactions can be extracted.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph does not mention any specific events or actions with defined timeframes, nor does it describe any explicit cross-scale temporal interactions.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: The 'Vision' of an organization is an aspirational, future-oriented goal, typically spanning decades or an indefinite future (>5 years).; Medium-Term: The strategic phrase 'we must work in partnership' is interpreted as an ongoing strategic approach or initiative, often implemented through plans spanning 1-5 years, aimed at achieving a broader long-term goal.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Long-Term, Medium-Term] Medium-term strategic partnerships are formed to achieve the organization's long-term vision.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The 'Vision' is classified as Long-Term, representing a goal beyond 5 years. 'Working in partnership' is interpreted as a Medium-Term strategic action, typically spanning 1-5 years, undertaken to achieve this vision. The explicit phrase 'To meet our Vision we know we must work in partnership' establishes a direct causal link where the Medium-Term action is a prerequisite for the Long-Term outcome.

Full Paragraph Text: The big development for 2014 has been the launch of our Partner To Win 2020 programme to create a supplier ecosystem where partners work with us and each other to create breakthroughs in products or packaging to deliver the capacity, innovation and sustainable solutions to meet our growth ambition. A great example is the new Dove Body Wash bottle using 15% less plastic (see inside front cover).
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The launch of Partner To Win 2020 programme occurred in 2014, representing a specific event within a single year; Medium-Term: Partner To Win 2020 programme is explicitly designed as a multi-year initiative running from 2014 to 2020 (6 years)
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term] 2014 programme launch initiates multi-year supplier ecosystem strategy through 2020.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph shows a clear causal link where a specific 2014 launch event (Short-Term) initiates and enables a multi-year strategic programme running through 2020 (Medium-Term). The Dove bottle example demonstrates outcomes from this cross-scale interaction.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: A specific 2014 launch is a within-year event.; Long-Term: The '2020 programme' spans ~2014–2020 (>5 years).
gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] A 2014 launch starts a 2020 programme, which yields an example: a Dove Body Wash bottle using 15% less plastic.
gpt5: Rationale: The text ties a 2014 launch to a programme running to 2020, then cites a concrete packaging outcome as an example of that programme’s goals. Only Short- and Long-Term scales are explicitly grounded.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The launch of the Partner To Win 2020 programme in 2014 is a short-term event.; Medium-Term: The Partner To Win 2020 programme is a multi-year initiative aimed at achieving goals by 2020.
4o: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term] The 2014 launch of the Partner To Win 2020 programme aims to achieve medium-term goals by 2020.
4o: Rationale: The launch in 2014 is a short-term event that initiates the medium-term Partner To Win 2020 programme. This explicit link shows a short-term action leading to medium-term outcomes.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Refers to specific events occurring within a year (e.g., 'big development for 2014', 'launch of programme') or distinct product outcomes (e.g., 'new Dove Body Wash bottle').; Long-Term: Refers to the 'Partner To Win 2020 programme' which spans 6 years (2014-2020), fitting the '>5 years' definition, and its overarching strategic goals ('create a supplier ecosystem', 'meet our growth ambition').
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] A Short-Term program launch directly leads to Long-Term strategic goals, which subsequently drive the creation of Short-Term product innovations.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The launch of the Partner To Win 2020 programme in 2014 represents a Short-Term event that explicitly initiates a Long-Term strategic effort spanning 6 years. This Long-Term program aims to create sustainable solutions, as exemplified by the Short-Term outcome of the new Dove Body Wash bottle, showing a bidirectional interaction.

Full Paragraph Text: Unilever’s value chain – the process by which we create brands, products and ultimately shareholder value – begins with acquiring insight into consumers’ needs, which vary considerably between developed and emerging markets.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's value chain process and consumer insights across different markets, but contains no explicit temporal references or timeframes. 4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's value chain process without specifying any temporal scales or explicit cross-scale interactions. It focuses on consumer insights without timeframes.

Full Paragraph Text: Insight requires close engagement with consumers, often over prolonged periods, and allows us to identify future trends to gain a competitive edge.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: Consumer engagement 'over prolonged periods' and identifying 'future trends' indicate extended timeframes; Short-Term: Gaining 'a competitive edge' represents immediate business advantage and market positioning
claude4: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Extended consumer engagement drives immediate competitive advantage through trend identification.
claude4: Rationale: The text establishes a clear causal chain where long-term consumer engagement activities lead to identifying future trends, which then enables short-term competitive advantages. The prolonged engagement represents the long-term investment that produces short-term business benefits.
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit durations or scale-specific timeframes are provided. Phrases like 'prolonged periods' and 'future trends' are vague and do not establish a clear cross-scale causal link.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph mentions engagement over prolonged periods and identifying future trends, but it lacks explicit timeframes or causal links between different temporal scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: The 'close engagement with consumers, often over prolonged periods' refers to the duration of the active engagement process. 'Prolonged' suggests more than one year but typically not decades for active consumer engagement, fitting within the >1 up to 5 year range (e.g., a multi-year research initiative).; Long-Term: 'Future trends' are significant, sustained shifts that emerge and unfold over many years or decades (>5 years). 'Gaining a competitive edge' based on such trends implies a strategic advantage that also lasts over an extended period, beyond five years.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Long-Term] Prolonged consumer engagement (Medium-Term) allows for the identification of future trends (Long-Term).
gemini2.5: Rationale: The 'close engagement with consumers, often over prolonged periods' is interpreted as a Medium-Term activity, lasting more than one year but typically less than five years for active consumer research. This engagement explicitly 'allows us to identify future trends,' which by definition are long-lasting shifts unfolding over many years or decades, making them Long-Term phenomena. The causal connection between the Medium-Term engagement and the identification of Long-Term trends constitutes an explicit temporal cross-scale interaction. While 'gain a competitive edge' is also Long-Term, its link from 'identify future trends' (Long-Term) is a same-scale interaction and thus not included.

Full Paragraph Text: That knowledge helps us to target our subsequent R&D activities and our investments in innovation. Unilever has filed more than 200 new patent applications in 2014 and our Partner To Win 2020 programme, also launched in 2014, creates a new platform for us to work with our suppliers in the development of product and packaging innovations that capture consumers’ interest and attention.

claude4: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that knowledge from immediate patent activities helps target subsequent R&D investments. The 2014 patent filings represent short-term output, while the Partner To Win 2020 programme represents a medium-term strategic platform that benefits from this knowledge.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Events explicitly in 2014 (within one year): filing patents; launching the programme.; Long-Term: The '2020 programme' implies a multi-year initiative from 2014 toward 2020 (>5 years).
gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] The 2014 launch of the Partner To Win 2020 programme creates a long-horizon platform with suppliers.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties a 2014 launch (short-term) to establishing a platform aimed at 2020 (long-term). Patent filings in 2014 are noted but not causally linked across scales, so excluded.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Filing of more than 200 new patent applications in 2014.; Medium-Term: Partner To Win 2020 programme launched in 2014, indicating a multi-year strategy.
4o: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term] Patent filings in 2014 support the multi-year Partner To Win 2020 programme.
4o: Rationale: The short-term action of filing patents in 2014 is explicitly linked to the medium-term strategy of the Partner To Win 2020 programme. This demonstrates a clear cross-scale interaction from short-term actions to medium-term strategic goals.

gemini2.5: Summary: N/A

No other phrases are assigned explicit temporal scales that would allow for the identification of cross-scale causal interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: Bringing these innovations to market as physical products is a core function of Unilever’s supply chain, which employs about 110,000 of our 172,000 people. It also involves working with suppliers around the world.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes current operational structure and employment figures without specifying timeframes or causal relationships between different temporal scales.
